author: Special Correspondent
text:
They want implementation of 7th Pay Commission without affecting allowances

Southern Railway Mazdoor Union (SRMU) general secretary N. Kanniah has said that the overwhelming mood of members of the union was in favour of the proposed indefinite strike demanding implementation of the 7{+t}{+h}Central Pay Commission without affecting the allowances and other benefits of employees.

Secret ballot

The SRMU which is affiliated to the All India Railwaymen Federation is conducting a secret ballot across the zone to seek the opinion of its members on the proposed strike. Mr. Kanniah who cast his vote in Chennai on Thursday said the mood of a majority of the employees favoured an indefinite strike.

“We are opposing the move to cut short allowances and withdraw benefits that the employees were enjoying over the years. The votes would be counted on Sunday and a decision on the union participating in the general strike and the dates would be announced the next day,” said Mr. Kanniah who is also the working president of the AIRF.
title: SRMU members favour indefinite strike: Kanniah
